page.title: 17Gourdon Mission Hall
page.content: Built in 1868, it was the dream come true of a native of the village called Kate Wyllie, who wanted to establish a {place of worship}and contributed significantly to its cost by the results of selling fish round the doors. At one time weddings were performed there, a practice which has now died out, although there is no particular reason why this should be. It remains the only place of worship to this day and services are held once a week, as well as{Sunday School and the Woman's {Guild,}all under the auspices of the {Church of Scotland. It is one of the few local places where the old-fashioned 'Redemption' or Sankey-type hymns are regularly sung and is indeed an "Ancient Landmark" in these modern times.
